content: kitchner stitch setup insert the tapestry needle into the first stitch on the front needle purlwise and leave it on the needle insert the needle into the first stitch on the back needle knitwise and leave it on the needle now repeat the following four steps until you reach the stitch count given in the pattern step 1 insert the needle into the next stitch on the front needle knitwise and slip it off the needle step 2 insert the needle into the next stitch on the front needle purlwise and leave it on the needle step 3 insert the needle into the next stitch on the back needle purlwise and slip it off the needle step 4 insert the needle into the next stitch on the back needle knitwise and leave it on the needle serenityxknits 3 knitting in serenity pattern _____________________________________________________________ cuff beginning by casting on 56 64 72 80 sts in the mc with a 2 25mm us1 needle use a longtail cast on or your preferred method join in the round next split the sts evenly to be able to work the magic loop technique there should be 28 32 36 40 sts on each needle your needle setup should look like this the first needle holds the front half of the sts which will later form the instep of the sock the second needle holds the back half of the sts which will later form the sole or back of the sock the bor is always located at the beginning of the instep sts you can use the cast on tail as a helpful reference if the tail is hanging on the right side of the needle you re at the bor ______________________________________________________________________________ leg now we are going to knit the leg of the sock row 1 - row 14 knit all sts in the mc now we will knit our first stripe cut the yarn or carry it on the back of the work and join the cc to prevent laddering in your striped sections i highly recommend using the jogless stripes method when knitting in the round you will now alternate 2 rounds of cc followed by 8 rounds of mc repeat these rounds until your sock leg reaches the desired length end with the mc for reference my misty meadow ruffle socks have a leg length of 6 5cm/2 5´´ this length provides a comfortable fit just above the ankle ideal for both casual wear and layering ______________________________________________________________________________ heel flap you ll begin the heel flap which is worked flat back and forth over the back half of your sts to avoid any slipped stitches in the mc on the heel flap simply knit one row and purl one row before continuing with the heel flap pattern as usual first knit the first 28 32 36 40 sts these sts make up the front sts of your sock which forms the top instep of the foot to create a contrasting heel cut
